text:
Aroma; barley malt, grass, caramel, plum peel.
Look; fawn head, copper clear body.
Taste; half dark malts, roasted note, caramel, modest hops - mild malty caramel finish.
Feel; mild, normal. 
Overall; very modest for this potential.
[50cl btl 5.8% bb.13.10.16 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */øypa]
Pretty sweet. Has an amber colour and is clear. Head is white. Aroma is malty, sweet, sugars. Flavor has notes of grain.
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hopy aroma. Moderate bitter nice caramellic flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle @ Johns. Pours amber with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grain, wood, hay. Flavor is malt, grain, light veggies, hay. Medium body, average to lively carbonation. 130416
Bottle, 5.8%. Clear amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted and toffee. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, sweet, hop, grainy, bread and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich caramel, fruits, malt, hops, flowers and hops. Nice sweet bitter finish.

Bottle thanks to Nikos! Pours clear burnt umber, light beige head, creamy and slow to dissipate with nice lacing. Aroma is caramel, toffee, bock-like, bready. Flavor is medium sweet, very light bitter, malty, caramel, hint of metal and smoke. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.
Itassa magát mint a szomjas ló! Amúgy a vízi lovak a víz alatt hogy isznak vizet?
Bottle. Pours dark amber with whiteish-beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, malt, caramel, grains. Flavor follows the nose. Carbonation is high. Overall: ok-ish

500ml bottle from 1420, León. @home 16-10-2015.
BBD: 19-11-15.
In short: malty tasty lager.
Pours amber-light copper with nice rocky off white to light tan head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Malty, caramel, licorice, spicy nose. Light body, average carbonation, crispy texture, with a silky mouthfeel. Nice balanced and quite enjoyable.

500ml brown bottle poured into a lager glass. Appearance is clear copper colored with a large frothy beige head, that reduced fast leaving a little lacing. Aroma of caramel, syrup loaf and toffee. Flavours of caramel, syrup loaf, toffee, nutty notes and brown sugar. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is light-medium bodied, slick texture and average carbonation. Overall a good style typical granat lager.
Draught. Pours a dark amber with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma of red fruits, toffee. Taste is copperish, toffee, red fruits. Light and refreshing, medium carbonation.
Shared bottle, many thanks my friend.  Amber color with medium off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light chocolate notes. Taste, caramel malt, grain, light roasty notes.

bottle at home from MMahut, european summer secret santa 2015, cheers Marek!bright amber, beige foam, herbal and bready on nose, fairly sweet, lightly bitter, malt led, growing sweetness, low carbonation.
Flaska från SB. Kopparfärgad vätska med massivt och tjockt skum. Brödig doft med antydan av kakor. Lätt karamellig smak med neutral beska. Lättdrucken altantörstsläckare.
Sep 11, 2007 Bottle from Pivovarsky Klub. Dark orange vienna. Eggy taste and amazingly creamy. Some malty, roastier notes. Bitter aftertaste. Quite a subtle beer.
Bottled , Prague , CZ , Ruby amber color with smaller lacing head , Malt,caramel,roasted and buttery aroma , Sweet taste with longer finish , Full body , Soft carbon , Pretty good.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je sladové s lehkým kvasnicovým nádechem. Pěna je světle hnědé barvy, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je patinově měděná. Chuť má ve středu příjemné kakaové tóny s lehkým nádechem sladu a banánů, fini je středně kávově hořký a drící. Pivo má střední říz. Celkově se jedná o zajímavé polotmavé s výraznou chutí a průměrnou pitelností.
Sample at a tasting. Amber body with a medium white head. Light palate, caramel.
Amber with an off-white head. Aroma has medium sweet bread, light sourness in the aroma. Flavor is caramel, sweet, malt, dough. Smooth malt mouth. Interesting and good.

Bottle @ The Flying Barrel, Gothenburg. Clear dark amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 260713
reddish-brown colour, medium off-white head; aroma of fruits and bread; taste is dominated by malty sweetness with fruitty notes (maybe some alcohol, too) and some slight bitter aftertaste.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090217.
Pours golden color with a small head. Aroma of hay, fruits, caramel and malts. Flavor of hay, butter, caramel and malts, some fruits too. Decent.
Pours red with smaller then I expected white off head. Aroma of  something sweet ,,, malts may be,  a bit burned caramel but in a good way. Taste is also sweet with bitter finish. I like it
Ive had this bottled and on tap.Pours dark amber with an off-white head.Sweet malty aroma with fruity,caramel,butterscotch,nutty,leathery,grainy, notes.
Bottle. Clear reddish copper color with a frothy head. Aroma of caramel, butter and some resin. Sweet taste of caramel. Sugary finish. Its a vienna well done.

Bottle at Pivovarsky Klub, Prague. Amber beer with à nice lasting beige head. Roasted caramel aroma, bready, toffee, biscuits, some fruits and hops. Roasted caramel flavor, milk, toffee, perfume, hoppy bitterness, some hay, some fruits. Roasted biscuits finish with metal notes.

Smallish, dense cream-coloured head over clear red-copper beer. Very restrained nose, sweet, bit nutt, caramel. Bitterish, nutty-wry and again caramel, but thinnish. Sweetness in the background, but finish is more faint metallic-bitterish. Very spritzy feel, but empty body. Thin, rather pale rendition of a Vienna.  Thanks, Honza!

Draught at the 4th Czeh Beerfestival, Bp.
Reddish brown pour with a medium head on its top.
Low-keyed, sweetish smell.
Moderate sweet and fruity aroma with caramel and grass, the finish brings some toast and spice along.

gusher.
clear dark amber, smooth beige head.
aroma is nutty, slightly honeyish, malty, caramelly, quite strong.
flavor is caramell, malty, sweet flowery. Not much bitterness, except some bitter caramel, but plenty of taste. a sweet vienna, but very tasty.

Zlý Časy, Prága. Áttetsző, enyhén sárgásvöröses világosbarna szín, tetején kevés piszkosfehér, kissé krémes hab. Illata malátás, aszalt gyümölcsös, és van egy izgalmas karamellás-grillázsos aromája is. Az ízében is előkerül a karamell, tovább egy kevés dió, és szépen ívelnek végig az ízek a végén betársuló, enyhén aszalt gyümölcsös komlónak hála. Inkább keserédes, száraz, közepesen testes és finoman szénsavas, igazán ízletes bécsi.
Bottled. Caramel aroma if you say so. Sweetish. Drinkable. My first Vienna, I guess.

Bottle at Klub. 
Pretty, glowing amber color. Big caramel nose with dried plums and raisins, earthy, with some wood as well. Sweet, burnt caramel taste, dried fruit. Lovely sweet, burnt flavor, well balanced. Earthy hops.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Pivny Galeria, Prague.
Poured deep clear amber with a medium lacing off white head. Aroma of caramel and molasses, some toasted grains, sourish bottom yeasts. Medium bodied one with a caramel and toasted malt background, some toffee and nuts, sourish yeast and a minimal sweet vanilla, minimal hop on the palate. Easy drinkable one, good for the style and could slip it for hours.

Bottle 0,5l. Best before 19.5.2010. Pours dark amber with a big creamy off-white, or almost yellow head. Aroma is weak dark caramel. Taste is overall on the malty side, without beeing to sweet, gets nice and "darker" towards the end. Low carbonation, and slightly sticky mouthfeel. Very good Vienna.

Bottle 0,5l. Best before 2.12.2009, over a month ago. Clear, dark, reddish brown colour with quickly dissapearing head.  Aroma is caramelly malty aswell as the taste but not too sweet. Points for that. Smooth mouthfeel and medium body. I’d buy again but it’s gone from our Alko’s.
Bottle @ Pivovarsky Klub. Pours dark amber with a creamy white head and lacings. Sweet caramel and bread. Smooth and full bodied. Very easy and pleasant well made vienna.

Poured from bottle into Flat Earth pint glass.

Clear, medium reddish-brown with thin head that dissipates too rapidly. Very light lacing.

Aroma for toffee, nuts, cherry and smoke. Overall, pretty good for a malty lager.

Very malty and somewhat sweet - caramel, plum, cherry and some nuttiness. Slightly spicy finish from the Saaz. I really wish the spiciness was stronger to balance the sweetness. Leaves a cloying aftertaste.

Moderate carbonation, medium body (relatively full for a lager and almost syrupy).

Nice to try something different from the Czech Republic, but I would prefer a Pilsner. That said, this is pretty good, but nothing worth seeking out.

Bottle from Beer of the Month club. Pours a red copper with a small head that quickly dissipates. Aroma was a malty caramel. Tastes of malty sweetness, it was more watery than I expected but thats not a bad thing. I started tasting a hint of vanilla halfway through that I did not pick up on right away. Good beer

Bottles via Bonster the monster in trade. Many thanks.  Pours a deep umber/copper with very little head other than the initial pour.  Sweet malts prevail in both nose and body. Vanilla tones apppear at edges for me and move no further.  Nutty earth tones light whisp about as well.  An easy drinking medium minsu body.  Creamy body dominates as the hops appear nearly at the finish...a bold move by any brewery so closely linked to the Zatec and Saaz hop regions.

Thanks to my BOM Club for this beer.  Pours a clear deep-ruby color with an off-white head. Aroma of bread dough, nuts, mild fruits and a hint of spice, notably vanilla. Flavor of pale malts, with a hint of caramel, and distinct noble hops, and the same bread and mild spice as the aroma. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a mildly bitter finish.  Had this beer at the brewery in Breznice, in Europe about two years ago and this brings back good memories.

Serving: 33 cl. bottle.
Appearance: Reddish brown with a small, foamy, off-white head.
Aroma: Light roasted malt notes, caramel, and a sharp hop note.
Taste: Caramel, nuts, some roasted notes, and a slight metallic note.  Some malt sweetness lingers in a medium-short finish.
Palate: Medium carbonation that is pretty crisp with a medium-full body.
Overall: A decent flavor profile and highly sessionable.
Deep amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of malt, slightly fruity with a metallic edge. Malty sweet flavour with some licorice and a touch of alcohol.
Bottle, 5.8%. Clear dark brown colour. Light brown head. Quite roasted flavour, a little raw liquorice. Faint hint of aroma hops. Late bitterness, quite rough.

Biggish shiny yellowish head. Dark amber body. Fruity peppery dusty aroma. Dry-sweetish banana roasty caramel taste with dusty watery grassy notes. Thin-to-mid body. Smooth mouthfeel. Lovely balance and harmony. Dry watery dusty roasty aftertaste with grainy notes. Very, very nice. About as good as a dark 14P will ever be. (0.3l draft, Pivovarsky Klub, Prague.)

Pours a clear glowing caramel amber with a medium sudsy off-white head.  Rich caramel malty aroma with subtle grassy notes.  That is a very good vienna... rich sweet toffee, lovely caramel, lightly grassy, sweet but not annoying, perfect amount of back-ground hops.  Great medium/full bodied mouthful, not sticky, fluffy softer fizzy abundant carbonation.  This is an excellent example and very drinkable.
Bottled. A dark amber beer with no head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel as well as light notes of alcohol. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of straw and caramel.

Sep 11, 2007  
Bottle from Pivovarsky Klub. Dark orange vienna. Eggy taste and amazingly creamy. Some malty, roastier notes. Bitter aftertaste. Quite a subtle beer.

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Red brown colour with thin head. 
Very weak aroma. 
Easy to drink, finishing with interesting cola flavours.

Bottle 50cl. @ home.Clear light to medium red brown color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly - fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, nutty notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (300808)

(bottle) pours a clear orange-ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of bread dough, yeast, sweet fruits and sweet spices, notably vanilla and cinnamon. flavour of pale malts, herbal hops, and the same bready spiciness as in the aroma. relatively strong body, with medium carbonation and a bitter finish.

Clear reddish orange-brown color with thick and lacy beige head. Aroma is caramely and slightly roasty malty with subtle hoppiness. Flavor is sweet caramely malty with obvious metallic notes, slightly grassy, bitter and woody in the end. Medium-bodied and smoothly caronated palate.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2008 Deep red-purple with a tan cream.  Sappy, well-toasted and toffee malts are set against grassy, lightly citric hops.  Strong toffee flavors dry into toast and light roast before a moderate bitterness and cola acidity; bright and citric aftertaste.  High, fine carbonation on a slick and slightly thick body.

Balanced and enjoyable though it feels a bit compressed, muted, at times.

50 cl bottle, best before 03 June 2009.

Reddish copper brown colour. Beige head. Mild nose. Malty and toffeish taste with some hints of burnt sugar and roasted malt. Also some hints of bluecheese in the taste. A 0.5L bottle from Alko shops.
500 ml bottle. Amber color, off-white head. Sweet malty aroma. Bitter-sweet taste of floral hops with dark syrupy notes. High carbonation. Not a personal favorite.

Bottle, bought @ Gallerie Piva, Prague.
Pours deep, clear orange-brown with a small, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, some caramel and light grassy hops. Medium carbonation, fine mouthfeel., Flavour is sweet, lots of caramel, some butterscotch and a good, long hoppy bitterness. A very good bottled Vienna.
caramel, hops aroma,amber, brown colour,medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, long finish,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: APR 12, 2009 At the tasting session by Joes. An amber colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of caramel and toffee and some spices. The taste is sweet caramel, with tones of spices. There is some hop. Its sparkling. It has a light bitter after taste.

(Draught at Pivovarsky Klub, Prague, 19 July 2008) Ruby colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, spicy nose with notes of wild berries. Malty, spicy taste with dark fruit, caramel and citrussy hops in the finish. It’s got a slightly metallic touch to it. Fairly nice and spicy vienna.

500 ml bottle. Clear, orange-brown colour, thin off-white head. Aroma is sweetish, malty, fruity, with some hops. Smooth mouthfeel, sweet, caramel-like malty flavour, nice hoppy finish. Overall, an enjoyable beer.
red brown clear with off white medium head. malty and a bit hoppy, smooth sweet syrup. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2008 bottle. pours ruby with creamy off white head. aroma is sweet toasted biscuit and hints of maple syrup. flavor is sweet maple syrup, some dark fruits, toasted biscuit, leathery hops. a little overly sweet but clean finish. a tasty vienna.

Bottled. Medium head forms a nice lace and is very pale beige in colur. Liquid is beautiful mahogany brown and clear. Malty aroma is somewhat sweet and has decent hops. Also dried sweet fruits like plum or raisins and nuts. Has quite the same aromatic caramel, almost honey-like sweet elements as many  brown ales. Though sweet, still quite fresh. Oily and smooth mouthfeel with increasing bitter dryness towards the finish. Enjoyably rich, "clean" and fresh overall impression.

(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of oh6gdx. Clear, amber golden with a dense, beige head. Malty aroma with some caramel. Quite full-bodied with a very solid malt base and notes of burned caramel. The finish is dry with a light bitterness. Lovely. 160408
Deep amber with medium off white head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel and fruity notes. Sweet malty flavor with caramel and light hoppy notes. Ends light bitter.

Bottle.
Clear orange coloured with a medium sized off white ehad.
Sweet and malty aroma of caramel and rye bread.
Flavour of malts, caramel and rye bread with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a light brown/orange and dense head. Aroma is light butterish and malty. Flavour is medium sweet and light spiced. Dry and light hoppy spiced and bitter finish.
Malty flavor with a little toffee and a lot of grassy hops in the finish. Higher bitterness than I expected.
Nice lager with rich but not too strong taste. Has some slightly bitter after taste.
bottle. Clear mahogany colour, medium-sized head. Fruity nose. Malty and fruity start, solid malty middle part and a slightly dry, pleasantly hoppy-aromatic finish.

500ml bottle (alko)
Rich red, thin head. Slightly perfumed and lagery aroma, some hops, some grains. Sweet and soft in the mouth. Plenty of sweet malts and noble hops. Malts are a little synthetic and plasticky, like a cheap German bock. Hops are a touch on the harsh side, but not quite metallic or astringent. But nearly. Too tangy to be an easy quaffer, too thin to be a sipper. Misses the mark.

Bottle 0.5 l. Nose is mostly syrup and burnt sugar. Flavor doesnt offer much more. A lot of metallic aftertaste. I dont find this very appealing and its a bit of a disappointment after the excellent schwarzbier.

Bottled, thanks oh6gdx!  Dark amber. Mediium bodied with lots of caramel and balanced sweetness. Chewy toffeeish malt gives well rounded mouthfeel. Finishes carefully salty and grassy. Really well balanced.

Amber colour with quickly diminishing head. Aroma has a strong caramel scent with a quite herblike hop note to it. Surprisingly creamy with a very good balance between hops and malts although mainly on the malty side. Quite sharp finish.
Amber of color with a beige head. An aroma of caramel, sweet apples, toffee and hint of hops. A flavor with caramel, bitter notes, sweet malt and dry finish.

Cask @ JDW, have had this rate in my phone for ages, just couldnt find the beer as it was labeled Bohemian Granat there. Deep amber with a foamy off white head. Nose of hops, malt and caramel. Hoppy and bittersweet with a sort of slimey syrupy mouthfeel.

Bright umber color with a moderate taupe head. Lightly toasted malt surrounded by a light floral scent. Somewhat sweet and simple in scent. Dry toasted malt flavors as well. Toffee and a light herbal bitterness. In a blind tasting I would have called this a typical american bock, darker and simple in most ways.

courtesy of oh6gdx - clear and bright amber-brown colour, little but firm pale beige head, some sweet toasted malts backed up by a decent aromatic hoppiness and some toffee notes; sweet and creamy mouthfeel, a late bitterness and a long finish of caramel - a good one

0.5 l bottle. Dark amber color with beige head. Sweetish aroma of toffee, caramel and toasted bread. Lots of caramel and toasted malt in flavor which gradually changes into nice chocolatey and bitter finish.

Cask at the Back of Beyond (JDW), Reading. Described as "Bohemian Granat" from "Pivovar Herold Breznice" and exclusive to JDW. A hazy chestnut colour with a dense cream head; a vegetative taste, not unpleasant, but slightly sour; with a nutty, fruity finish.
(Bottle)  Pours a clear amber body with a tall beige head.  Aroma of nuts, caramel, and raisins.  Flavor of caramel malt, toast, toffee, and some cocoa.

(Bottle BB 06/03/07) Caramel, slightly roasted and slightly hoppy aroma with a hint of metalness. Red brown colour, clear and average size, light brownish, more or less fully diminishing head with faint lacing. Sweet, caramel, slightly roasted and slightly bitter flavour. Soft/lively carbonated and medium-bodied palate with a hint of metalness. 19/04/07

Copper colored with a tan bubbly head.  Aroma of hay and roasted malt.  Lighty sweet to bitter flavor.  Bread-like, malty flavor, earthy.  Light metallic tinge.  Finished on a mild bitter note.  Watery palate with decent carbonation.  Not bad.

Bottled (BB 03/2008)
Clear dark amber color, small vanishing tan head. Very lively beer, coming out of bottle by force. Caramelly and buttery aroma with woody Bohemian-like hops and hints of iron. Caramelly flavor but not overly sweet - more like dry and bitterish. Light roastiness (toasted rye bread) and tinkling  hops in the aftertaste. Easy going Vienna, good brew in its style as their superb black lager.

Dark amber colored, little light brown head. Aroma has caramelly sweetness with chocolate and some buttery hops, hints of roastiness also there. Medium bodied. Flavor is also sweet with caramel and biting hoppiness, mild alcohol comes also up. Carbonation is rather high. Some metal in aftertaste.

Bottled. Dark amber colour with big beige foamy head. Toffeeish, caramellish, metallic and fruity aroma. Flavour is fruity hops and mild roasted notes. Some sweet malts dominate the whole thing. Refreshing and quite pleasant.

(Bottled) Clear dark ruby-brown with a small, mostly fading head. Toffee-caramely-malty, slightly metallic aroma with slight roastiness. Mildly roasty and sour, sweetish, toffee-malty flavor with medium bitterness. Velvety-smooth, medium-bodied palate with soft carbonation. A very easily drinkable, yet reasonably tasty brew. Nothing special, though, if youre already past the I dont like dark beers phase...
Very attractive malty aroma.  Dark brown color with a small head.  This beer has both a spicy aftertaste and subtle hops that complement the malt profile very well.  This is a very satisfying beer.

From a narrow neck slender 330 ml. bottle with a coded freshness date on the back label.

Poured a clear reddish amber with a foamy, bubbly topped off-white head that settled into a thin, slightly sudsy lacing.

Aromas of plums and raisins, a subtle nutty banana, floral and sweet caramel bready.

Good moderate carbonation and a softly crisp, smooth medium-light bodied mouthfeel.

I read on the website that this brewery has its own well, a unique water source, and from the lagers Ive tried from this brewer, I believe it, a subtle mineral quality to go along with fresh plum fruitiness, caramelized sugery, a light toasted graininess, with a metallic edge to the malts, a soft earthy spiciness, and a malty, metallic finish.

bottled. pale shade of copper, steady pale head. bockish aroma of burnt banana, plum and brow sugar. tasted of banana fritters with caramel sauce. hints of cocoa, some alcohol bite, pretty much like a bock with a fraction less alcohol. gets more drinkable as it warms, actually pretty nice

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2008 Labled as Bohemian Granát Lager
Pours brilliantly clear, deep amber brown color and is topped by an initially three-finger thick, creamed amber colored head.  A predominantly dry aroma, with perhaps a touch of caramelized malt character.  This smells like Munich malt, lightly toasted and lots of chewy melanoids.  The aroma is quite nice, though it is fairly subtle.  Aromatic notes of toffee become noticeable at times as well.

Malty sweet, not cloying, but laden with complex sugars that run the gamut from caramelized through to just lightly roasted.  The finish has a drying character, contributed by light roast notes & predominantly toasted notes, that makes you want to take another sip to get back to the up front complex malt sugars.  Nicely bitter, though not so much do take away from the dominant malt character.  The bitterness, in combination with the carbonation, adds a bit of a spritziness to this beer.  Also in the finish the hop bitterness and toasted malt notes seem to combine to give an almost tannic character.  Spicy hop notes are also here, but play a subservient role to the malt character.  This is a really nice beer, it just drinks so smoothly.  It has enough of a body to accentuate the chewy malt character, but is still light enough to be perfectly quaffable.  I am quite impressed, this beer is definitely hitting the spot right now.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2006 Beautiful amber color, and a fluffy beige head. Sweet, malty aroma. Initial flavor is semi-sweet toffee, followed by nut and coffee. If it were a little less sweet, I would give it a higher rating. Very nice carbonation.

Bottle: Copper coloured, thin but stable and lacing white foam; caramel and sweet toasted malt in the nose; mild, but distinctive hops in the wings; sweetish bitter flavour, medium bodied; caramelly, sweetish finish with a dash of bitterness. A bit on the sweet side, but all in all a  very pleasant pivo !
Ceskemu pivu zdar ! Ceske pivo cislo stopadesat........

Bottle. Pours copper with a decent head. Aromas of chocolate,malts and caramel. Flavors are complex, a sweetness, flavors of caramel, and a bit of candied apple. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet finish. Excellent.

12 oz bottle via Malt of The earth beer club. Pours a clear dark amber with a large head. Nice subtle nose with notes of vanilla, toffee, molasses, and some mild hops. This is a very tastey beer with a very nice aftertaste. Medium body, average carbonation. Flavors of molasses, caramel, and a tiny bit of spiciness that i cannot put my finger on? Cardomom? Nice balanced bittersweet aftertaste leaves you longing for the enxt drink. This is a pretty tasty beer albeit a mellow beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Plantagenet, Leicester. Amber beer with a light head.  The aroma is syrupy and sherbet and the flavour is strawberry, fizzy and bubble gum with a gentle bitter finish.  Overall a strange malty concoction.

Cask, The Last Plantagenet, Leicester.  Amber/red with a small head.  Aromas are sweet light malts with mellow lemon, earthy hops and some cream.  Flavours are mild toffee and caramel malts with thin sweet lemon.  Lightly fruity with pear.  Some metal and spices.  A thin, muddy mess.  Too sweet for my tastes.  OK for a glug.
[cask at JDW] Nice red colour with a dense, maintaining head. Soft aroma of toffee, dark fruits, plums and a tickle of hops. Full bodied, sweet up front leads to a finish with a little dryness.

Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Copper coloured, beige head. Sampled straight after the Budels Alt, and I can see some similarities in style between the two. This though was a little more tangy, with breaths of hop and perhaps orange. Firm and long in flavour. This is nicely bitter and drinkable.

Cask conditioned @ Giddy Bridge, JDW, Soton. Deep amber with dense head. Malty toffee with fruitiness (berriess and faint banana). Creamy sweet taste smoothly followed by light bitterness. Suprisingly short finish which leaves you wanting more.

On handpump at the Shakespeares Head (JDW), Kingsway. very nice clear burnished bronze colour, with a hint of red. Im not sure Id call it ruby. The aroma has an almost Belgian quality - sticky hops, sweet malt and that cahracter I always associate with "candi sugar" (I know its not actually candi sugar, but I know whqat I mean). Toffee, caramel and lots more sweet malt in the flavour. Very mellow. There are some hops skulking about, but their impact is not great until they give just a little kick on the finish. Interesting, but a bit too sweet for my taste without anything to provide balancing bite.
Cask at County Hotel (JDW) Ashford.  Red coloured ale.  Caramel malt on nose with sweet alcohol in mouth.  Flavour of stewed plums and vanilla on end.  Interesting, but not worthy of a second pint

Cask: Ruby amber, small white head with brilliant lace. Malty toffee aroma with some interesting fruity notes. Sweet fruity flavour with some plum and berry along with caramel. Light spice in the finish. Very smooth body. Nice stuff.

Cask conditioned - JDW - Birmingham.  Well after much deliberation on the site weve decided this is a new Herold beer and are listing it as a vienna for now.  A reddy copper coloured beer which a thich creamy whitish head.  It certainly seemed very lively when pulled even without a sparkler.  The aroma is light berry fruits.  The taste is quite creamy with notes of strawberry blancmange and fizz bomb sweets (I wonder if anyone else remembers those?).  An interesting tasty beer which seems to have a Belgian character to it.   Well done to JDW for putting this on at their fest.
